title: 114_hr4533
content: The Act may be cited as the "Net Price Calculator Improvement Act" and establishes minimum standards for net price calculators. Section 132(h) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include minimum requirements for net price calculators, to be met within one year of the Net Price Calculator Improvement Act's enactment. The Calculator Improvement Act requires that a net price calculator on a higher education institution's website be clearly labeled, prominently displayed, and match other prominent links on the primary menu. The Calculator Improvement Act mandates that a net price calculator on a higher education institution's website must be clearly labeled, prominently displayed, and match other prominent links on the primary menu. Additionally, the calculator's results screen must specify the net price, cost of attendance, and other relevant financial information. The curr_chunk discusses the average annual costs for books, supplies, and other expenses for a first-time, full-time undergraduate student enrolled in an institution, along with estimated need-based and merit-based grant aid from Federal sources. The curr_chunk provides information on the percentage of first-time, full-time undergraduate students receiving grant aid and includes a disclaimer for a calculator that estimates eligibility for veterans' education benefits. The curr_chunk clarifies the display of education benefits for active duty service members on the results screen, distinguishing them from grant aid. It also ensures that the calculator does not estimate eligibility for these benefits but provides a link to relevant information. The net price calculator for higher education institutions must clearly indicate required questions, mark optional contact information requests, and prohibit the sale of users' personally identifiable information. The net price calculator for higher education institutions must prohibit the sale of users' personally identifiable information. SEC. 3. UNIVERSAL NET PRICE CALCULATOR. Section 132(h) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to include a provision for a universal net price calculator. This calculator would allow users to input information once and receive net price estimates for any institution required to have a net price calculator. It must provide specific information for each institution and undergo testing and evaluation before being publicly released.
